activities.message:
Hi Manish! Thanks for providing the additional info. The output shows that the SPF check did fail. It is a `softfail`, which is caused by the `~all` directive in our SPF record. Gmail should mark any email with a failed SPF check as spam. Would it be possible that you accidentally moved the email to the inbox or marked the email as non-spam during your testing?

Furthermore, the account `merjin@hackerone.com` does not exist, so could you try this again with for instance my email address (michiel@hackerone.com)? Please let me know when you've sent the spoofed email, so I can keep an eye on my spam folder in case it ends up there.

Also, I'm not sure why that Microsoft tool is reporting we don't have an SPF record, because we do have one. You can look it up yourself by using `dig`:

```
root@hackbox:~# dig spf hackerone.com

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;hackerone.com.         IN  SPF

;; ANSWER SECTION:
hackerone.com.      300 IN  SPF "v=spf1 include:_spf.google.com include:sendgrid.net ~all"

root@hackbox:~# dig txt hackerone.com

;; QUESTION SECTION:
;hackerone.com.         IN  TXT

;; ANSWER SECTION:
hackerone.com.      300 IN  TXT "google-site-verification=kJvJzY2RGMDtepgunvIygWQUdE0rRfqFkpUttAuLFEk"
hackerone.com.      300 IN  TXT "v=spf1 include:_spf.google.com include:sendgrid.net ~all"
```
